channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Want AI agents to work better? Improve the way they retrieve information, Databricks says
item.description: Databricks is debuting a new system for retrieving the data that AI agents need to perform tasks accurately.

item.title: You Don’t Need a Eureka Moment to Start a Company
item.description: Six steps to ideate your way to a new business

item.title: Morgan Stanley files for bitcoin, solana ETFs
item.description: Morgan Stanley is seeking regulatory approval to launch exchange-traded funds tied to the price of cryptocurrency tokens, according to filings with th...

item.title: From Latin America’s richest country 100 years ago to a founding member of OPEC, the long history of Venezuela’s oil and U.S. ties, explained
item.description: In the 1990s, Venezuelan society became further split between the wealthy, who wanted to work with the US, and the working class, who didn't.

item.title: The new Skims Team USA collection is the ‘Juicy Couture’ of Olympic partnerships
item.description: Kim Kardashian’s apparel brand Skims is outfitting American athletes at the Olympics for the fourth time in a row, and this year’s collection is its c...

item.title: Are We in an AI Bubble? Hedge Fund Giant Ray Dalio Thinks So
item.description: The billionaire investor joins Sam Altman, Mark Zuckerberg, and others in speculating about the tech sector’s precarity.

item.title: When brands play hard to get: why you’re drawn to products that neg you
item.description: We call this “dissuasive framing.” Instead of saying a product is perfect for everyone, a company is up front about who it might not be for.

item.title: The organization behind decades of public TV is dissolving—what comes next
item.description: Six decades after it was created by Congress, the nonprofit that brought America Mister Rogers’ Neighborhood and Sesame Street will shut down for good...

item.title: Amazon is cutting checks to millions of customers as part of a $2.5 billion FTC settlement. Here’s who qualifies and how to get paid
item.description: The $2.5 billion package ranks among the largest enforcement actions in the agency’s history.

item.title: Gen-Z Is Changing Work Culture—Here’s What Leaders Are Doing About It
item.description: More young people will join the workforce this year—and company leaders are looking for ways to retain them.

item.title: People are using Grok to create lewd images of women and young girls
item.description: Elon Musk took over X and folded in Grok, his sister company’s generative AI tool, with the aim of making his social media ecosystem a more permissive...

item.title: Ray Dalio says AI is in ‘the early stages of a bubble,’ so watch out for 2026
item.description: After strong returns in U.S. markets last year, 2026 might be a different story.

item.title: Deepfakes of Maduro are a reminder that AI content thrives in political chaos
item.description: In moments of political chaos, deepfakes and AI -generated content can thrive. Case in point: the online reaction to the US government’s shocking oper...

item.title: LG Says Its New Robot Can Do Tricky Household Tasks. The Company Is Staying Quiet on 1 Key Detail
item.description: Fold your laundry. Toast your croissant. The CLOiD droid, shown off at CES, aims to do it all.

item.title: Trader Joe’s Is Selling Inexpensive Prebiotic Soda, but Customers Are Complaining
item.description: The retailer just threw its hat in the better-for-you soda ring.
